Issues.Title: fix(ivy): error when encountering an empty class attribute
Issues.Body:
Fixes Ivy throwing an error if it encounters an empty class attribute in a template (`class=""`).

This PR resolves FW-972.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): error when encountering an empty class attribute" (#28321)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): View Queries inheritance fix
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change `viewQuery` functions that represent @ViewQuery list were not composable, which caused problems in case one Component/Directive inherits another one and both of them contain View Queries. Due to the fact that we used indices to reference queries, resulting query set was corrupted (child component queries were overridden by super class ones). In order to avoid that we no longer use indices assigned at compile time and instead maintain current view query index while iterating through them. This allows us to compose `viewQuery` functions and make inheritance feature work with View Queries.

Note: Content Queries have similar issue and it will be resolved within the next PR.

This PR was created based on the changes from the previous one #28304 (which is now closed) and after some additional debugging due to the failing CircleCI task.

This PR resolves FW-829.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): View Queries inheritance fix" (#28309)

Issues.Title: feat(core): Make TestBed.get() type safe.
Issues.Body:
Added stronger type declarations to TestBed (for both pre-Ivy and Ivy)
using conditional types from TS2.8. The TestBed injector should now
infer the correct type given the InjectionToken or the class.
Future work is needed to make the Injector class just as type-safe.

Fixes #26491

BREAKING CHANGE: TestBed.get() used to return `any`, which allowed for
bugs to creep into tests because of potential abuse of the lack of
types. Because TestBed.get() is now stronger-typed, incorrect uses of
the return value will now cause a compilation error.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
```ts
get(x: any, y?: any): any;
```

Issue Number: 26491


## What is the new behavior?
```ts
get<T>(x: T): T;
get<T1, T2>(x: T1, y?: T2): T1|T2;
```
(with use of conditional types to return an actually useful value)

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [x] Yes
- [ ] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->
Abuse of the lack of type safety will now cause a compilation error and force users to explicitly cast to `any` if they want to keep abusing the return values' type.
Incorrect use due to the lack of type safety will now cause a compilation error and users will notice this problem and fix their tests.

## Other information

I plan to go ahead and do the same for Injector.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(core): Make TestBed.get() type safe." (#28325)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): Content Queries inheritance fix
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change `contentQueriesRefresh` functions that represent refresh logic for @ContentQuery list were not composable, which caused problems in case one Directive inherits another one and both of them contain Content Queries. Due to the fact that we used indices to reference queries in refresh function, results were placed into wrong Queries. In order to avoid that we no longer use indices to reference queries and instead maintain current content query index while iterating through them. This allows us to compose contentQueriesRefresh functions and make inheritance feature work with Content Queries.

This PR resolves issue FW-754.

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
When it comes to Pure Pipes, changeDetection triggers only when the value changes but a pipe also depends on a service value internally(not as an args). if the service value changes the pure pipe won't detect for changes because it is changed in `.ts` file.
Alternative: to use impure pipe but it is impacting my application performance

Why I'm not mentioning the pipe args here is.
I have to inject my service into the component where i'm using my pipe and pass the value as an args into the pipe so that angular check change detection when value changes.
But I'm using it in 100s of component on all that i have to inject this service and pass as an arg. it is a biggest painfull for a developer.

**For example assume this lib `@ngx-translate/core`**
developer: @ocombe 

In this lib `translate` is a impure pipe. Because it depends on a service value internally. In an application it will be 100s of places. But we know when the language value will be changed. then going for a impure pipe is a performance impact.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Need another function in `pure pipe` class to rebind the value manually.
```javascript
PipeTransform {
    transform(value: any, ...args: any[]): any;
    rebind(): void; // function with any suitable name
}
```

I will trigger this function as a callback to rebind the pipe text when service value changes so that we don't have to go for impure pipe `when we actually know the when the service value will be change.`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): View Queries inheritance fix
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change `viewQuery` functions that represent @ViewQuery list were not composable, which caused problems in case one Component/Directive inherits another one and both of them contain View Queries. Due to the fact that we used indices to reference queries, resulting query set was corrupted (child component queries were overridden by super class ones). In order to avoid that we no longer use indices assigned at compile time and instead maintain current view query index while iterating through them. This allows us to compose `viewQuery` functions and make inheritance feature work with View Queries.

Note: Content Queries have similar issue and it will be resolved within the next PR.

This PR resolves FW-829.

Issues.Title: fix(router): `skipLocationChange` with named outlets
Issues.Body:
With #27680, a bug was fixed where multiple redirects using `eager` URL update could cause navigation to fail. However, that fix introduced a problem where with `skipLocationChange` enabled, the URL tree rendered was not properly stored for reference. This specifically caused an issue with named router outlets and subsequent navigations not being recognized.

This PR stores the correct `UrlTree` for reference with later navigations. It fixes the regression introdued with #27680.

Fixes #28200

Issues.Title: docs(animations): fix group and sequence function usage examples
Issues.Body:
animate functions now contain style functions instead of plain objects
e.g. `animate("1s", { background: "black" }))`
to   `animate("1s", style({ background: "black" }))`

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

The `sequence` and `group` function comments display the example in the function comment in the following way

```
animate("2s", { color: "white" }))
```

where the `style(` is missing.

## What is the new behavior?

The function comment for `group` function will display the usage example

```
group([
  animate("1s", style({ background: "black" })),
  animate("2s", style({ color: "white" }))
])
```

and the comment for `sequence` function will display the example

```
sequence([
  style({ opacity: 0 })),
  animate("1s", style({ opacity: 1 }))
])
```


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test

- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run

- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
ng lint --format=json > issues.json
Worked previously as describe here:  [#4959](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4959)
Worked for outputting results to json or any format.

In Angular 7 there was the addition of color to the output of lint results. This has broken the above workaround for outputting to a file.

what was previously like:
```
[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/app/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
]
```

is now like so

```
[37m[
    {
        "endPosition": {
            "character": 144,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 361
        },
        "failure": "Exceeds maximum line length of 140",
        "name": "C:/myProject/src/spp/modeling.component.ts",
        "ruleName": "max-line-length",
        "ruleSeverity": "ERROR",
        "startPosition": {
            "character": 0,
            "line": 8,
            "position": 217
        }
    }
][39m
```


### Solution I would like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I would like an option added to ng lint to output to a file easily


### Workaround
"ng lint --format=json | sed -r \\"s/\\\x1B\\\[([0-9]{1,2}(;[0-9]{1,2})?)?[mGK]//g\\" > issues.json"
Which is ugly but works

Issues.Title: Ability to configure output path for source maps
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
**Ability to configure output path for source maps**

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When I create a production build using `ng build -prod --sourcemaps`,
I would like the ability to configure the output path for the source map files,
So that my source maps will not be deployed with my application.

### Describe the solution you'd like
A dedicated --source-map-output-path build command to configure the output path of the source maps only.

The output of the build should continue to go to --output-path=./dist
The source maps should go to the path specified by --source-map-output-path

### Describe alternatives you've considered
The current solution is a post-build script that moves the *.map files from the --output-path=./dist directory into a different target directory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ability to configure output path for source maps" (#13508)

Issues.Title: ng-add easy support for libraries
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

It is very common that when we generate a library, we want to add `ng-add` support, and it is tedious to have to configure it (in addition, __there is no or I have not found documentation__ to carry out the process).

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add a flag `--ng-add` to generate a library with a schematics project (with collection.json) and a default scehamtic `ng-add`.

__Example:__

`ng generate library <lib-name> --ng-add` : it generates a new library with a configuration described in __Describe the solution you'd like__

### Describe alternatives you've considered

If this is not possible, add a __step-by-step guide__ explaining how to configure it to the official documentation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng-add easy support for libraries" (#13505)

Issues.Title: Add relevant css lint to generated project
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When running the command `ng new example-project` the user is prompted to select a css framework type. This is added to your project and you can quickly start development. However it does not add any quality standards/tests for css, scss, sass, less. This means either a project doesn't have consistent css standards or they have to be manually added later.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Automatically add the relevant css linting tool to the package.json

- https://www.npmjs.com/package/csslint
- https://www.npmjs.com/package/sass-lint
- https://www.npmjs.com/package/lesshint

And of course add the relevant command to package.json e.g.
```
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve",
    "build": "ng build",
    "test": "ng test",
    "lint": "ng lint && sass-lint",
    "e2e": "ng e2e"
  },
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Manually installing the library for every new project, or ensuring every developer has it installed in their Code Editor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add relevant css lint to generated project" (#13502)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): e2e test fails strict TS config
Issues.Body:
If using `strictFunctionTypes: true` in `tsconfig.json`, the default e2e test introduced in `7.3.0-beta.0` is failing compilation with:

```
error TS2345: Argument of type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to parameter of type 'Expected<Entry>'.
  Type 'ObjectContaining<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'ObjectContaining<Entry>'.
    Type 'Partial<{ level: Level; }>' is not assignable to type 'Partial<Entry>'.
     Type '{ level: Level; }' is not assignable to type 'Entry'.
```

Explictely using `as logging.Entry` fixes the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): e2e test fails strict TS config" (#13493)

Issues.Title: build: add missing bazel action names
Issues.Body:
In order to have proper action names when running bazel, we should add progress messages for all custom rules. Currently Bazel always uses the first input as action name, but this is *very* confusing since failures lead to the input file, instead of the associated Bazel action.

Note that this is not really a progress_message, but it is consistent with native bazel actions (e.g. `StarlarkAction`)

Issues.Title: JAWS (18.0.5038) loses "forms mode" for legacy mat-form-field with floatLabel="never"
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
JAWS should be able to retain "Forms mode" (ignore jaws shortcuts) when typing in an input-field.

#### What is the current behavior?
After typing a letter (causing the label to go invisible) in a text input field JAWS is thrown out of "forms mode" (indicated by a pop sound). This happens for mat-form-fields with legacy appearance with the floatLabel-input set to "never"

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
- use JAWS screen reader
- Navigate to form field with tab or keyboard arrows (the form field should have the input floatLabel set to "never")
- Listen for the "pop" sound that indicates JAWS is now in forms mode (when forms mode is set to AUTO)
- type a letter
- be sad when JAWS shortcuts get triggered when you try to type 

https://jaws-forms-mode-mat-form-field.stackblitz.io/


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
reproduced in
Angular: 7.0.1 and 7.2.0
Material: 7.0.2 and 7.2.0
Typescript: 3.2.2
Chrome 71 and JAWS (18.0.5038)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "JAWS (18.0.5038) loses "forms mode" for legacy mat-form-field with floatLabel="never"" (#14927)

Issues.Title: [Menu] Cannot pass from one menu to another
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When creating a menu inside a toolbar when clicking on the first item (a button that open a menu) i would except the second menu to open when the mouse enter the next menu item in the toolbar.

#### What is the current behavior?
You need to click on the second item of the menu to open the second menu. This is totally logical, because root menu items are simple button, but if you try to create a complex menu toolbar, users are used to menu that open automatically without the need to click (apart from the first time)

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
you can look here for the kind of menu that i mean : https://stackblitz.com/edit/dynamic-nested-topnav-menu?file=app%2Fapp.component.html
if you click on the first item ('DevFestFL') and them move your mouse on "Didney" or "Orlando" you would except, as a user, that the corresponding menu open automatically. Instead, you need to click on the item.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
"@angular/animations": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/cdk": "~7.2.1",
"@angular/common": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/compiler": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/core": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/forms": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/material": "^7.2.1",
"@angular/platform-browser": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~7.2.0",
"@angular/router": "~7.2.0",
"core-js": "^2.5.4",
"hammerjs": "^2.0.8",
"rxjs": "~6.3.3",
"tslib": "^1.9.0",
"zone.js": "~0.8.26"
```

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I understand why this is happening and it seems that we would need to have something like a `mat-menu-toolbar` that could automatically 'open' a mat-menu-item and show it to the user (horizontally or vertically) like that we could have a coherent way of showing simple menu and complex one without so much effort.

thanks !
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Menu] Cannot pass from one menu to another" (#14924)

Issues.Title: mat-select and mat-autocomplete options have different font sizes with custom typography
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
`mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete` options should have the same font size (and consequently same height), when a custom `$input` value is set via the `mat-typography-config()` function.

#### What is the current behavior?
When setting a custom `$input` value with the `mat-typography-config()`, `mat-select` options change their font-size accordingly, but the `mat-autocomplete` options ignore it, and use 16px instead (default).

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nzfhqa?file=theme-styles.scss
On `theme-styles.scss` file, try commenting line 4, to use theme default values, or switch the `mat-typography-level` function first argument to any another value (other than 16px), and observe the changes on the `mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete` options font size.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Currently testing on Angular 7.2.1 and Material 7.2.1.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select and mat-autocomplete options have different font sizes with custom typography" (#14915)

Issues.Title: Menu divider margins out of spec
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The [menu spec](https://material.io/design/components/menus.html#specs) shows that a divider in a menu is supposed to have an 8px top/bottom margin.  

#### What is the current behavior?
In the current implementation, the margin is zero.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-menu-divider)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All? I guess?

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Trackback to #2017, where the feature was introduced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Menu divider margins out of spec" (#14912)
